comments.author: ipalatt
comments.subject: The Bad Girls of Bishop
comments.body: Congrats on the big send, dude!

comments.author: ipalatt
comments.subject: Horse Flats
comments.body: Great day out at the flats, Itai! Again, sick flash! Get psyched for the Black Mountain sessions this summer! Wild Things, Bang On, Twilight, Beowulf, Ex-Pat, the list goes on and on. You guys should try to send them all!

comments.author: Dan Beall
comments.subject: Vegas, Baby!
comments.body: I love that you call them problems lol.

replies.author: Itai Axelrad
replies.body: *routes, haha. hope you make it to the black mt bash.

comments.author: ipalatt
comments.subject: Malibu Creek
comments.body: Yeah boyeees! Let's go back soon to send! (and to try that sick looking boulder proj!)

replies.author: Itai Axelrad
replies.body: I'm down. Let me know when you're free.

comments.author: devlin
comments.subject: Malibu Creek
comments.body: nice to see people working the projects out here

comments.author: devlin
comments.subject: Malibu Creek
comments.body: Also, pretty much everything in that area under V8 has been climbed, including the V5 and V3 above.

replies.author: Eden Axelrad
replies.body: Thanks for letting us know, I updated the blog.

replies.author: Eden Axelrad
replies.body: There are direction on this website http://www.parks.ca.gov/?page_id=614. Sorry for the late response, I hadn't seen the comment.

replies.author: Itai Axelrad
replies.body: Thanks, nice to hear from you.

comments.author: Chris
comments.subject: Red Rock, NV
comments.body: Hey do you happen to have a video or any beta/tricks you could give me for triple sow cow? I tried it today and failed so bad! No position felt good for the jump really. And now I 'm really just confused by it. Thanks!

replies.author: Eden Axelrad
replies.body: Hey Chris! I think the trick on this one is to really commit (once you find a slightly less awkward starting position). Good luck man!

comments.author: Half Circle G
comments.subject: Back To Black
comments.body: Hey Itai and Eden! Love the blog. Quick question for you. I'm planning on hitting Black Mountain this weekend, February 12-14, and just wanted to make sure the road to Black Mt was open. I mean it would seem obvious since you just posted this but, who knows, could have been an old post you made that you guys just decided to put up. I called the ranger station to ask about the road but they are closed on Thursdays... Anyway, can you guys confirm the road is open? Thanks so much!

replies.author: Eden Axelrad
replies.body: Hey! Sorry for the late reply. The road to Ok Corral is open, however, you need lots of clearance because it's in poor condition.

replies.author: Itai Axelrad
replies.body: My apologies for not seeing this earlier, Jason! The season seems to be coming to an end and sadly we have not made it back out.

comments.author: Unknown
comments.subject: CO Sample Platter
comments.body: Very very cool, you'd make them goat's jealous ðŸ™ƒ

comments.author: Tristin Rubia
comments.subject: Teahupoo v11/12
comments.body: Hi, this is a long shot but just found out about Teahupoo and the climb looks incredible. I was wondering if you happened to have a pin for the location of the boulder or any idea how to get there. From what I understand the boulder is by itself in one of the valleys in Black Mountain but I don't have any other information aside from that. Thank you so much in advance!

replies.author: Itai Axelrad
replies.body: Hey! Unfortunately, I don't have a pin. If my memory serves me, it's about 5-10 minutes downhill from Howel's Moving Castle. Good luck, and sorry I can't be more helpful than that.

replies.author: Tristin Rubia
replies.body: Thank you so much! I'm gonna start looking next time I head out there!

comments.author: xj
comments.subject: Allegory of the cave
comments.body: I liked your video of Allegory of the cave (black mountain) and the static beta you used! Do you know who did the first ascent of it? Curious about this problem's background story

replies.author: Itai Axelrad
replies.body: The guide book authors, Ian McIntosh and Alan Moore helped develop the Republic area around 2009. Alan is a philosopher and was working on his dissertation at the time which explains all the names.There are some blog posts of the area but they donâ€™t explicitly state who got the FA. Could also be some other strong climber of that era like Alex Savage or Dave Struthers. There is a video of Alan climbing the line to the left, Metamorphosis but Allegory is not chalked up yet.
